tickets.subject: Chat with Joe Parsons
tickets.description:
Chat started on 2016-12-13 10:10 PM UTC

(10:10:42 PM) *** Joe Parsons joined the chat ***
(10:10:43 PM) Joe Parsons: Just sent campaign for 298 Stanford Ave. Menlo Park to Support@APR.com....both floor plan line drawings are truncated...had talked to Edgar earlier today.   My goal is to show complete views for each....can you help please
thanks, Joe Parsons
(10:11:43 PM) *** James Vargas joined the chat ***
(10:12:16 PM) James Vargas: Hi Joe give me one moment
(10:12:25 PM) Joe Parsons: OK
(10:14:52 PM) James Vargas: From your conversation with Edgar it looks the image wasn't cut off in savi?
(10:15:08 PM) James Vargas: He also spoke with you about providing us with an example?
(10:17:09 PM) Joe Parsons: I sent the campaign to support@apr a few minutes ago....did you see it?
(10:17:45 PM) James Vargas: No I didn't. You may have the wrong email address. It should be sent to help@apr.com
(10:18:06 PM) Joe Parsons: Oh...OK....sending right now
(10:18:38 PM) James Vargas: Sure no problem I will take a look at it once it reaches our ticketing system
(10:19:59 PM) Joe Parsons: Just sent it...
(10:20:24 PM) James Vargas: Thank you Joe
(10:20:29 PM) James Vargas: May take a minute or two
(10:21:32 PM) Joe Parsons: That's fine....seems when you select and download line drawings into campaign....the bottom gets cut off?
(10:22:21 PM) James Vargas: This is only after you send the campaign?
(10:22:51 PM) Joe Parsons: yes...I think so
(10:24:12 PM) Joe Parsons: It was my seller who noticed it and asked me to correct those two pictures so they aren't truncated
(10:25:37 PM) James Vargas: I think if this is occuring when its sent, it could be just the size of the image being uploaded. I checked your campaigns and it looks fine in the preview
(10:26:23 PM) James Vargas: I'm not sure why, but the email hasn't reached our ticket queue
(10:26:43 PM) Joe Parsons: sent to Help@apr.com
(10:27:14 PM) James Vargas: Have you tried resizing the images before adding them to your campaign?
(10:28:26 PM) James Vargas: It looks zoomed in on two of the images
(10:28:56 PM) Joe Parsons: NO, because they are already small and hard to see floor plan....impossible to see written words on line drawings.  That can be done I think...at Kinkos
(10:29:48 PM) James Vargas: http://www.joeparsons.apr.com/property/56040605/298_Stanford_Ave_Menlo_Park_CA_94025
(10:29:57 PM) Joe Parsons: Its just the floor plan images....others are fine
(10:30:21 PM) James Vargas: If you take a look at the link and select the floor plan images they are zoomed in
(10:30:36 PM) James Vargas: Are these the images that are cutting off?
(10:32:32 PM) Joe Parsons: No, on what you just sent the very bottom of each floor plan is cut off not showing a portion of the 1st and 2nd floor floor plans....probably 5' in real life
(10:33:35 PM) Joe Parsons: just the two floor plans have the problem the first three are fine
(10:33:48 PM) James Vargas: So if you click on the two images on the right end of the pictures, its not those images that are cutting off?
(10:34:01 PM) James Vargas: Take a look at the last two on the right
(10:35:32 PM) Joe Parsons: facing it's the two pictures on the far right sownloaded to campaign;  only 5 of the six images can be used in a campaign
(10:36:06 PM) James Vargas: Yes that's the two images I'm talking about
(10:36:35 PM) James Vargas: If you notice they are zoomed in on the link I sent you
(10:37:07 PM) Joe Parsons: The link you sent me  above shows them being cut off
(10:38:03 PM) James Vargas: This is from the campaign when I try to view the photos
(10:38:28 PM) James Vargas: I think you'll need to resize the images because then they are cut off as you explained
(10:40:12 PM) Joe Parsons: It may look normal to you....but having seen the site and original line drawings I can tell that the very front of the house (both 1st & 2nd floor) are cut off....it probably represents about 5' of the real house
(10:40:15 PM) James Vargas: Give me a moment to speak with my project manager
(10:40:57 PM) Joe Parsons: sure!
(10:45:28 PM) James Vargas: My project manager is in a meeting I couldn't find him at his desk
(10:45:52 PM) James Vargas: I took a look into the property on your exclusives and the image looks normal there
(10:46:54 PM) James Vargas: What I recommend doing is removing the floorplan images from your exclusive, resize them to make it fit, then try sending out the campaign again
(10:46:57 PM) Joe Parsons: Can you ask him later and connect with me again this afternoon.  It seems to happen when you down load the 5 pictures....and only affects the floor plan drawings....
(10:47:43 PM) James Vargas: Yes I understand Joe. I can send you a link to resize the images but you'll have to remove them from exclusives and upload them after editing
(10:48:10 PM) James Vargas: The two images are zoomed in so they cut off in your campaign
(10:48:43 PM) Joe Parsons: What if I sent you (scan) the actual drawing for you to inspect to see if it's just too large or positioned wrong on the paper.
(10:49:43 PM) Joe Parsons: OK, please send the link and I will try
(10:51:10 PM) James Vargas: Its not about the image being on paper, its about the image file size and the way Savi handles it is that in some way it crops the image and leads it being cut off on the bottom
(10:51:12 PM) James Vargas: http://resizeimage.net/
(10:51:43 PM) Joe Parsons: thanks
(10:51:48 PM) James Vargas: The link above will guide you on how to resize the image
(10:52:12 PM) James Vargas: If you make the dimensions a little bit smaller that should avoid the images being cut off
(10:52:29 PM) Joe Parsons: OK, I will try...
(10:54:24 PM) James Vargas: Do you have copies of the images you can email us?
(10:54:34 PM) James Vargas: Not the scan but the image files
(10:55:12 PM) Joe Parsons: I am at home, but I think so.....I will send them if they are here
(10:55:54 PM) James Vargas: Sure find out if you do and I can see if I can figure it out
(10:56:14 PM) James Vargas: I just need the image files that were uploaded for the exclusive
(10:58:24 PM) Joe Parsons: Just sent both 1st & 2nd floor floor plans
(10:59:39 PM) Joe Parsons: What I just sent are what I used to upload those images for my campaign
(11:01:34 PM) James Vargas: I got the images Joe
(11:02:21 PM) James Vargas: Let me see what I can do
(11:03:36 PM) James Vargas: I will follow up with you once I have it figured out
(11:03:39 PM) James Vargas: Thank you for using the APR Helpdesk Chat Support.  Let us know if there's anything else we can do for you.

Have a great day Joe Parsons!





! --------------
A Ticket will be submitted with the chat transcript automatically at the end of this conversation.

#close
(11:05:10 PM) Joe Parsons: Thank you very much for your help!!
(11:05:53 PM) *** Joe Parsons left the chat ***

tickets.subject: Fw: Website Template for recruiting
tickets.description:
Hello,


Can I have someone address this question raised by Joanne?  Will we have something along these lines shortly?  She didn't mention them, but I am aware of the presentation PU gives agents surrounding Digital Marketing and it is very compelling.  It was 4 years ago when I went up against them in Santa Rosa(luckily my agents loved me and didn't leave!).


Thank you,


Tim Freeman

Vice President and Manager
BRE License #01892312
Serving Marin and Sonoma Counties
Alain Pinel Realtors
BRE License #1272467

Phone:  (707) 933-6200
www.apr.com/tfreeman



________________________________
From: Joanne Zavlaris
Sent: Monday, April 17, 2017 2:09 PM
To: Tim Freeman
Subject: Website Template for recruiting


Hi,



After trying to work with Danielle today and connecting with Anna in the SF office, it has come to my attention that we DO NOT have a website template to use for recruiting.  Anna still uses Rick’s “live” website which is not ideal.  It is not a good idea to use a live website as the internet can “grab hold” and then a potential recruit could have an APR website that we lose control over.



I am stumped as to why it is so difficult to create a website template, drop in pertinent information (taken for the agents existing website at current brokerage) and use it when recruiting.  As I have shared, we did this in SF, using Rick’s and the recruits were impressed and joined APR.



This is what I am competing with in Marin.  When Heidi Pay, Kate Hamilton and Kevin Patsel meet with potential recruits, they have a digital presentation about their respective companies, they also have the recruit presented with their website, business cards, announcement, a frame signs and yard signs, all with their company branding.



I lost a recruit today, a mid-level producer with ties to the peninsula (in my mind a natural for APR) to Golden Gate Sotheby’s.  She told me that the daunting effort of switching companies was made visually easy for her because she saw the transition right in from of her on an Ipad.  ARRGGHH!!!



I am willing to take the time to do this step.  I can make the website, and all of the collateral materials so that nothing is left to the imagination and our presentation can represent our luxury brand and true concierge service.  However, I need someone to create a website template.  Or, I need someone to tell me it cannot be done and I will move on and work on creating other recruiting materials.  I don’t mean to state the obvious, but if this is done at other brokerages, we should be able to do the same.



I am requesting a template, one that resembles our website.  I want to be able to add a recruits name and bio (taken from their existing website).  I want to be able to show this at our first sit down.  I want a market report with their info on it and our branding.  I want proofs of business cards, signs, etc.  I would love a digital PR piece on APR and on Tim Freeman.  PLEASE let me know the barriers between these requests and fruition.



This is me when we lose a recruit for NO reason!!!!!!



Joanne Zavlaris

SALES MANAGER - MARIN OFFICES

ALAIN PINEL REALTORS®

BRE#01755146

D 415-246-8661 | O 415.755.1111 X2945

jzavlaris@apr.com<mailto:jzavlaris@apr.com> | apr.com<http://www.apr.com/> | linkedin<https://www.linkedin.com/in/bardwilliams>

tickets.subject: Profile Photo Not Pulling to Campaign
tickets.raw_subject: Profile Photo Not Pulling to Campaign
tickets.description:
Chat started on Thursday, May 11, 2017 12:10:16 PM

(12:10:16 PM) *** Visitor 4559924 has joined the chat ***
(12:10:16 PM) Jayne: Patrick Ryan is creating an eFlyer. His photo is not showing up in the test email. He does have a profile photo in his Agent account. Am I missing something?
(12:10:23 PM) *** Chelsea Wester has joined the chat ***
(12:10:35 PM) Chelsea Wester: Hi Jayne
(12:10:56 PM) Chelsea Wester: Patrick can upload his profile photo in his SAVI > My Info section.
(12:11:16 PM) Jayne: It's already there.
(12:12:15 PM) Chelsea Wester: And his profile photo isn't showing up in his CRM Campaign?
(12:12:24 PM) Jayne: No.
(12:12:28 PM) Chelsea Wester: Can I have the name of the campaign he's working on?
(12:13:00 PM) Jayne: Hold on please :-)
(12:13:38 PM) Jayne: 376 Eagle Trace Drive
(12:14:11 PM) Chelsea Wester: Let me take a look at his account.
(12:14:25 PM) Jayne: Thanks.
(12:16:42 PM) Chelsea Wester: That is very strange!
(12:16:53 PM) Jayne: Srsly
(12:16:57 PM) Chelsea Wester: Let me check in with our project manager here really quickly for any suggestions.
(12:17:04 PM) Chelsea Wester: Give me one moment please.
(12:19:53 PM) Jayne: BTW, I tested it more than once to see if by chance it was sent when the server was temporarily down.
(12:20:06 PM) Chelsea Wester: This is definitely a bug.
(12:20:26 PM) Chelsea Wester: I would suggest deleting all of his profile photos in his My Info section and re-uploading his main profile photo.
(12:20:47 PM) Chelsea Wester: Which might reset the photo and pull correctly.
(12:20:55 PM) Chelsea Wester: I don't want to delete any thing in his profile.
(12:21:45 PM) Jayne: I'll try that when he returns. Thanks, for the workaround. Fingers crossed. :^)
(12:22:09 PM) Jayne: Bye
(12:22:18 PM) Chelsea Wester: You're very welcome!
(12:22:30 PM) Chelsea Wester: Let me know if that doesn't work so that we can escalate the bug to our web developers.
(12:22:54 PM) Jayne: Will do.
(12:23:20 PM) Chelsea Wester: Perfect.
(12:23:24 PM) Chelsea Wester: Thank you for using the APR Helpdesk Chat Support.  Let us know if there's anything else we can do for you.

Have a great day Jayne!





! --------------

Description

Diamond in the Rough! This home has endless possibilities: remodel, create your own new vision! Excellent setting bordering Los Gatos nestled close to the foothills offering beautiful views. Charming neighborhood close proximity to Award Winning Union Schools: Alta Vista Elementary, Union Middle and Leigh High Schools. Single story home, 1,434 sq. ft. offering three bedrooms and one bath. Kitchen with built in oven, electric stove top, refrigerator, tile counter top with breakfast bar. Formal dining room off the kitchen. Spacious living room with fireplace. Step down family room with vaulted ceiling, exposed wood beam and large storage room with built in shelves.

tickets.subject: Chat with Tim Allen Jr.
tickets.description:
Chat started on Monday, September 18, 2017 9:28:55 AM

(9:28:55 AM) *** Tim Allen Jr. has joined the chat ***
(9:28:55 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Hello:

I am unable to connect to Tour Factory using the tile in SAVI.  This is a repeat issue.  How can I get this fixed?

Thanks!
(9:29:08 AM) *** Elise Cuevas has joined the chat ***
(9:29:26 AM) Elise Cuevas: Good morning Tim.
(9:29:38 AM) Elise Cuevas: Let me look into it for you.
(9:29:57 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Thank you
(9:30:40 AM) Elise Cuevas: Which account are you using?
(9:30:48 AM) Elise Cuevas: Team account or personal
(9:30:53 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Massey Allen Group.  The only accoun that we use.
(9:31:09 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Account*
(9:33:27 AM) Elise Cuevas: Hi Tim your account for Tour Factory is up and working.
(9:33:41 AM) Elise Cuevas: Please test it out before we disconnect.
(9:34:15 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Ok.  Thank you.  This is a repeat issue.  Maybe the 3rd time.  How can we prevent this from happening in the future?
(9:34:35 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: I am able to connect to my team Tour Factory account now.
(9:35:32 AM) Elise Cuevas: If someone is making changes to your SAVI account, please ask them to leave the SAVI ID section the way it is.
(9:35:45 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Who would do that?
(9:35:55 AM) Elise Cuevas: Make sure nobody deletes the SAVI id that's the only way that this can happen
(9:35:59 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: We do not make any changes to our SAVI ID.
(9:36:29 AM) Elise Cuevas: If it happens again please reach back out to the helpdesk
(9:36:51 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: I have every time it happens.  Can a permanent fix be made?
(9:37:18 AM) Elise Cuevas: only the changes that I just made now.
(9:38:03 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Ok.  I'm not sure why this keeps happening and it is frustrating.
(9:40:22 AM) Elise Cuevas: I apologize for the inconvenience. We can not track who is deleting the ID
(9:41:14 AM) Elise Cuevas: I'll also open a ticket with our web developer, to see if there is any issues with this account.
(9:41:24 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: We have only had this issue since we transitioned to the new SAVI.
(9:41:57 AM) Elise Cuevas: Please advise all users that use this account to not delete the SAVI id
(9:41:59 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Our team account will work fine for awhile then all of the sudden tiles are no longer connected to our team account.
(9:42:04 AM) Elise Cuevas: Thank you.
(9:42:12 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: No one deletes the SAVI ID on our end
(9:42:41 AM) Elise Cuevas: I will open a ticket with our web developer, to see if there is any issues with this account.
(9:42:47 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Thank you
(9:43:09 AM) Elise Cuevas: I apologize for the inconvience.
(9:43:24 AM) Elise Cuevas: Is there anything else I can help you with?
(9:43:37 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: I understand it is not your fault.
(9:43:47 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: That is all
(9:43:52 AM) Tim Allen Jr.: Thank you
(9:44:08 AM) Elise Cuevas: You're very welcome Tim.
(9:44:13 AM) Elise Cuevas: Thank you for using the APR Helpdesk Chat Support.  Let us know if there's anything else we can do for you.

Have a great day Tim Allen Jr.!





! --------------

tickets.subject: Fwd: Wire Fraud on the Buyer offer side
tickets.raw_subject: Fwd: Wire Fraud on the Buyer offer side
tickets.description:
Help...this is coming from Angela's husbands email because hers has been hacked...watch for more...what is the next step?

Sent from my iPhone

Begin forwarded message:

From: Dennis White <whiteden@live.com<mailto:whiteden@live.com>>
Date: September 23, 2017 at 6:02:06 PM PDT
To: "cburnett@apr.com<mailto:cburnett@apr.com>" <cburnett@apr.com<mailto:cburnett@apr.com>>
Subject: Wire Fraud on the Buyer offer side


I have just been made aware of a wire fraud where the crooks hacked into my account and pirated the APR system of my emails.  The crooks have taken my account  when I made an offer for my client.  We did not get the offer and I informed my client via email that we weren’t chosen and that we needed to go out some more.

At this point, the crook had taken over my email account and my cell phone number account.  Each time I sent an email to my client they took it and each time she responded they took it. The crook pretended we got the offer accepted and proceeded to tell her where and how to wire good faith funds and down payment.

She dutifully followed those instructions.  Sending over over $100,000.  Meanwhile, each email I sent to my client was ignored so I thought she was busy.  I finally go a response from “her” saying her phone had dropped in the sink and that I needed to only respond to her by email for a day.  This was Friday, the day all the money was being wired. According to my buyer she also received an email from me saying the same thing.  Consequently today being Saturday, I phoned her and she wondered why we needed to look at properties.

I am so sick about this.  I never expected this on this end. I was expecting it with title but not on just making an offer.

Consequently, the crooks have dumped back into my sent file all the communication of how they took the money and even have sent me a text style email taunting me saying “How sweet does Sam think you are now?” They sent two taunting messages.  I went to my sent file and found all the emails the crooks had sent and printed them out.  I went back 5 minutes later and it all has been deleted from my sent file. I had also tried to print the ‘text’ messages in my email account and they would not print.

My client says they sent her the signed contract and everything.  She is going to send that to me.

On Tuesday I couldn’t get into the my email account so I phoned using our office phone, ITT.  ITT told me how to change my password and then decided he would change it for me.  I wrote the offer on Tuesday.  It wasn’t responded to by the agent till later that day and that was by email.  I sent a note Wednesday to my client saying I had not heard back yet.  By Thursday morning I got notification from the agent that we did not get the house.  I sent my buyer a note saying we  didn’t get the home so back to looking at properties on Thursday. She did not respond.  I sent another note Friday morning requesting we go look at more homes, I got an email stating she had dropped her phone in the sink and that she wouldn’t be reachable by phone until Friday evening.  I touched base with her on Saturday and then she called me stating she didn’t know why we needed to look at more homes.  And that’s when the fraud was discovered.

I can be reached at 408 821-6492 to discuss.  She has gone to her banks this afternoon but I believe the money is now gone.

Please respond only to whiteden@live.com<mailto:whiteden@live.com> – my apr account is being hacked and I do not want to use it until IT contacts me to change my password.

I am sending all papertrail that I managed to print and my client managed to print before they deleted everything.

Angela White
Realtor
Saratoga Office


Sent from Mail<https://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=550986> for Windows 10

PPG NAMES 2018 COLOR OF THE YEAR





PPG is a 134-year-old global supplier of paints, coatings and industrial materials based in Pittsburgh, Pa. that recognizes trends in the industry.

In a recent article from Freshhome, PPG named 'Black Flame' as their 2018 Color of the Year for its modern, intimate and soothing shade. Soon after, PPG's Olympic paint brand announced its own shade of black for their 2018 Color of the Year. For more information, read on<http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=X7KNde2uw8V3m7eFsByGa11S3XgornlhXaUEn6X2DetOoh3xkFVLce-2FaUZszzv3c5dYShkdwQwguARq4a6MOwA-3D-3D_YTL1fq-2FI-2FvQTEdpVZ6-2Bq2ILgTkVr8lL-2FJRiOQHIaYzQPpEOSt6-2F-2FVctnEqDAWdBuu2T1cxfhrJtoQ41qgUjAbiZ8ufGuw-2B0koJERKgp2i-2FmflTpAnbecQMxI0dfN7rPhBJRPLROJw7GhjUXxshKxxVYO44VPRx-2FpcTPhc4W997B-2Feget-2BfbBeAgnFQ6ygGlt15rT1-2FLv43EjSQi85rwU-2F6UiJIliy5rldPv8NLSXfn5CfKT13G4mmspltvzx6USKi-2FWuJ4b7vjChcOcVf8TjUfpyOUTWcSfK4UX9WnMj13L0Z1R92ktSDpsJN55-2FfnzQCkP5dmx6B2jb3F7Vb2U2GWsgs9xa-2B0OYFkTu916VKE0KAD7bwL4qMN6GBrFuI7PlDCYir-2FAd-2FwOqtvtj8huj8eaLA-2BPCSBE92RjyJ3MOnvU-3D>.

BAY AREA HOMES SELL ABOVE LISTING PRICE,
CREATE BIDDING WARS

Dozens of homes in Cupertino and Sunnyvale have been selling for at least $200,000 more than the listing price. This is a reflection of the competitive real estate market in the region.

In a recent article from The Mercury News, Alain Pinel's Mark Wong of the Saratoga office explains what's causing this and why the listing price for homes in this market is never concrete. For more information, read on<http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=gzE8dieFSORMhubyXzDWzXWbXGsYkyOCKLGS4Cio7pUAPYSSk8rqJDFe1oOBCoGJD2HQGBJ489EOxKerOXUB-2F94nZUsFl-2B8euG-2FPazuA1KRSst5vceoD7KuRx59HQQ4XzJg4fehgJqh3lrIiqkp1WsHGc0q9FhEWe6AKPIwTvHo-3D_YTL1fq-2FI-2FvQTEdpVZ6-2Bq2ILgTkVr8lL-2FJRiOQHIaYzQPpEOSt6-2F-2FVctnEqDAWdBuu2T1cxfhrJtoQ41qgUjAbiZ8ufGuw-2B0koJERKgp2i-2FmflTpAnbecQMxI0dfN7rPhBJRPLROJw7GhjUXxshKxxVYO44VPRx-2FpcTPhc4W997B-2Feget-2BfbBeAgnFQ6ygGlt15rT1-2FLv43EjSQi85rwU-2F17-2FJz6pl7UTi-2BoHaXDJr3iCVxmrdGN3pWPosfi2WqemfPODl1FuBf-2FFTbodqKMgIDLoUBId1sYz4Ct-2F-2BoAOJXzfB6N6C9r0RG6Gt9l6n7-2FiZ-2FLDD-2FyrgJ8V2TKjR5oKAHy4ckxH-2BjADAvM6mNYV-2BWiWm74zKwT62eHVP3ILLh9AuobMHqyDuyDQveh-2B5kB-2BNTxZxY3vu5bE-2FoTiWiPpYxE-3D>.

APR CARMEL LISTING WINS HGTV'S ULTIMATE
HOUSE HUNT

HGTV recently completed its global competition with 48 companies and listings in 14 different countries, naming APR Agent Greg Albertson's $2.295 million listing in Carmel as the 'Living Large in a Small Spaces' winner. The home, listed at 2 SW 11th in Carmel, is a 1,566 custom cottage built in 2007.

Two APR listings in Carmel were finalists for the 'Living Large in Small Spaces' category of the competition. We congratulate both Melanie Rolfe Rosen and Greg Albertson for being nominated, and to Greg and his clients for winning in the Small Spaces category. For more information, read on<http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=gzE8dieFSORMhubyXzDWzXhE-2FrrGB5i-2FyYBGeZzrs2xTw-2BOu3RXqaKbCfgOU6i-2B1GUouTxQr40d0rrV-2BZNt0AdLP8b7LCwHf1XCYxcTWAmJWyPPH-2FbOwEFPsZhFJIS2oShxGLQ4ovud0l9ZaVb1LnA-3D-3D_YTL1fq-2FI-2FvQTEdpVZ6-2Bq2ILgTkVr8lL-2FJRiOQHIaYzQPpEOSt6-2F-2FVctnEqDAWdBuu2T1cxfhrJtoQ41qgUjAbiZ8ufGuw-2B0koJERKgp2i-2FmflTpAnbecQMxI0dfN7rPhBJRPLROJw7GhjUXxshKxxVYO44VPRx-2FpcTPhc4W997B-2Feget-2BfbBeAgnFQ6ygGlt15rT1-2FLv43EjSQi85rwU-2F6zXfbHOVH84hUiFyhDxsOJhR0JZ-2F-2BVHEB0fAU8dZ3E-2FqrSLF1tMeqlxghQxjHVoCepL5cszJuocVeUKgzHnIXDP62juQ9Y2ebv2DpEFhseHJVDGLRAoVldw-2Fy-2BRivODzjFKS5mTaN15qCQJu6oiRrPKgQElX9ohfYclrY690c0t27kUnSouh6QrqHleC7Ya80fe5m0vYe6QO7INia55Vno-3D>.





PULSE OF THE REAL ESTATE MARKET: WHERE WE ARE AND WHAT COMES NEXT

By David Bellamy

Last February, I predicted an early start to a hot spring real estate market<http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=IhAoXgHIt-2FKdq-2F20VXV8ss7Eefl7k1chuavu3uN6RBsg6rASYb1gXARniKMzPNmtaB4AdW5yghUMpxemX2nmX7Q01EySMPMz1k2wMcKV4bowJzvTm70x3XTQBp0KsLBR_YTL1fq-2FI-2FvQTEdpVZ6-2Bq2ILgTkVr8lL-2FJRiOQHIaYzQPpEOSt6-2F-2FVctnEqDAWdBuu2T1cxfhrJtoQ41qgUjAbiZ8ufGuw-2B0koJERKgp2i-2FmflTpAnbecQMxI0dfN7rPhBJRPLROJw7GhjUXxshKxxVYO44VPRx-2FpcTPhc4W997B-2Feget-2BfbBeAgnFQ6ygGlt15rT1-2FLv43EjSQi85rwU-2F-2Fw2-2BiEOP98KItV9KDwhun7VuN0nawKzHxyE2KTqoHd0-2BAYqnEqvVhKi3HdjsJzufdvUWSUM69Bo-2F1GXWcUj3EQKa8pnfNLoKEO3bqI67Z59pBhpGLi5qx-2B2Hgf0HO5ELUetcByKz-2BbfVfNwX065QXPOa5n6kNOr6IhVKg0O-2FT6mh3saU9ZkmSg2dKBHRlWCkTir8UrcnmTeu7zWcEAdYv4-3D>. By and large, that prediction was borne out with entry level housing remaining competitive while the luxury market followed its conservative, but expansive momentum into the summer.

At the close of the second quarter of 2017, those predicted trends remain mostly constant: rising home prices in San Francisco continue to push buyers eastward into Alameda County, where overall median home prices rose 9 percent over the same six-month period in 2016. There were few outliers in this trend. Median home prices for Q1 & Q2 of 2017, compared to that same period in 2016 rose:

[https://d25g4fe4iv8jd0.cloudfront.net/article-images/44/44/2017_september_article_image_01.jpg]

Inventory continues to be the driving factor in both the decrease in number of units sold as well as generally rising home prices across the Bay Area and Northern California.

Due to the economic climate, the real estate market in our region continues to shift. The impact of limited inventory and changing tech, biotech, advanced manufacturing and other industries is evident. Median home prices are rising while the number of closed sales in terms of units across all of the 10 counties served by Alain Pinel Realtors have mainly declined. Again, this is due primarily to limited inventory. A few exceptions included Santa Clara and San Mateo counties, both with 1 percent increases in the number of closed sales year-to-date through June 30, 2017 compared to the same period in 2016. San Francisco and Napa counties experienced 2 percent increases in closed sales during the same period.

We can expect to see this pattern to continue through the balance of 2017, driven by an ongoing pattern of limited inventory, the expected and continued uptick in mortgage rates and any related shifts in key Northern California employment sectors. Given the shortage of opportunities for buyers through 2017 and the reluctance of potential sellers to dive into the market, buyers and sellers alike will need experienced agents to help them gauge the best opportunities in individual markets and show them how to plan accordingly.

The good news is many of those agents are at APR. We were once again ranked as the number one brokerage in 2017 in many of the most desirable Northern California markets. This is due in large part to our agents maintaining a deep network of potential sellers, having a keen understanding of the real estate landscape, offering outstanding customer service and being able to discern and advise clients on the difference between irrational exuberance in the market from otherwise solid buying and selling decisions.

tickets.subject: Xpressdocs: Doug Lambert MLS 40799808 Not Transmitted
tickets.raw_subject: Xpressdocs: Doug Lambert MLS 40799808 Not Transmitted
tickets.description:
Hello,

  Please see the message below, Doug’s MLS number is not feeding into Xpress docs so his listing is not showing under “My Listings” for him to be able to easily create “Just Sold” post cards. Xpress docs has told us they are not receiving the MLS number and to contact our IT department to see why it is not feeding directly into Xpress docs. Please advise.

 

LISA DUNCAN

FRONT DESK CONCIERGE/MARKETING COORDINATOR

Alain Pinel Realtors® Montclair | Alameda 

O 510.339.8900 | E Recpt1mc@apr.com

apr.com

 

 

From: Olivia Hernandez [mailto:ohernandez@xpressdocs.com]
Sent: Friday, October 13, 2017 12:30 PM
To: Mayela Saldana
Cc: Judy Boone; David Wood
Subject: Xpressdocs: Doug Lambert MLS 40799808 Not Transmitted

 

Hello Mayela,

 

Thank you for reaching out to us today. I want to extend my sincere apologies for the issues your Marketing Coordinator had, with one of our call center representatives. It’s our desire to meet or exceed our clients’ needs, with our products and services. At this time, Doug Lambert’s MLS No. 40799808 isn’t showing up in our system. I’ve checked his Xpressdocs account, and I do see other listing coming over without issue. Is it possible to contact your IT department and let know the transmission from MLS to get to us? It might be that the e-mail address on the listing may not match our records for receipt. We have the following e-mail address on file for Doug: dlambert@apr.com, anything outside of this might be the cause we didn’t get it. Let me know. I’ve cc’d my manager as per your request; you can convey your experience with them since they were not available to take your call earlier.

 

If you have any additional questions or concerns let us know. We appreciate your business and have a wonderful day!

 

Kind regards,

 

Olivia Hernandez

CLIENT CONSULTANT

o: 866.977.3627| f: 817.870.1205| xpressdocs.com

4901 North Beach Street, Fort Worth, TX 76137

tickets.subject: Newsletter Issues - Images in Footer
tickets.description:
Below is a copy of my monthly newsletter.  The top and bottom images aren’t showing up.  Can you fix this for me?

From: Microsoft Office User <stevecomfort@apr.com>
Date: Tuesday, October 17, 2017 at 11:14 AM
To: Microsoft Office User <stevecomfort@apr.com>
Subject: Real Comfort | October 2017

Alain Pinel Realtors

 

View this email in your browser

October Update
From Steve Comfort

 
 
 

 
 

PPG NAMES 2018 COLOR OF THE YEAR
 

PPG is a 134-year-old global supplier of paints, coatings and industrial materials based in Pittsburgh, Pa. that recognizes trends in the industry.

In a recent article from Freshhome, PPG named 'Black Flame' as their 2018 Color of the Year for its modern, intimate and soothing shade. Soon after, PPG's Olympic paint brand announced its own shade of black for their 2018 Color of the Year. For more information, read on (http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=B9zvP7-2B7e043Z-2FT0SCNjT1HqXj953TuonV38u952lR3XVe-2BMmcuE6YSONEKOVj6ineXCBotIQXqftN8kFm6wSQ-3D-3D_aXojoE8p6FFhi0fBXE9V1LziNhIp9s9MNoZg3crHJiFgPyK4QH1EdLRK5b18SMnZswnAnCJyz1e3r81hqR1nGu-2BfzDh-2BTQvSpXaqbiEeXAGt1-2BrIxk8lYD-2B36172UlVEUUN4-2BDck3omKt1pwH8F82R0jQlcADri-2BUl1CLe1l9E1mcgBPxjERTXWJUkcuj9LKbFi5418PJG-2FVcgrMcYustSQElQ13gIPlWGxQQbd7nRGpUa3D1u4DTcrihJx5q225DgnMxa8PeaGt5CQmdtl-2FJ5ur9CWkEuJk6TZBrJ3O6sZfnp-2BTHmsfCJYZ-2BoTxxY7tis97k-2B04QjATz0ae6oX7I6UXpOKpqKuybfbRB4RDjDbvw8OLPkwt31-2FyqZuQuu9McHKYlzdSt5cnegAoe7julA-2FuemKjp6IiHwPZCUQTDM4-3D) .

BAY AREA HOMES SELL ABOVE LISTING PRICE,
CREATE BIDDING WARS

Dozens of homes in Cupertino and Sunnyvale have been selling for at least $200,000 more than the listing price. This is a reflection of the competitive real estate market in the region.

In a recent article from The Mercury News, Alain Pinel's Mark Wong of the Saratoga office explains what's causing this and why the listing price for homes in this market is never concrete. For more information, read on (http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=9eRBURSqPvOmurN-2FVMHiAQRGNfFEmHQaFfYKvXC8WDtHZT5DJCsGV11btTn2XgAiTiEExDYQbphpqIvtWX-2FgbkxAMaoaaBoaqXtJD7ZawDYh8wVwrELbPH3UIV7Nc0j7SoF5WNvbkFpIH-2FbH-2BDDafg6HLtvllAvfk1PodwxaIaM-3D_aXojoE8p6FFhi0fBXE9V1LziNhIp9s9MNoZg3crHJiFgPyK4QH1EdLRK5b18SMnZswnAnCJyz1e3r81hqR1nGu-2BfzDh-2BTQvSpXaqbiEeXAGt1-2BrIxk8lYD-2B36172UlVEUUN4-2BDck3omKt1pwH8F82R0jQlcADri-2BUl1CLe1l9E1mcgBPxjERTXWJUkcuj9LKbFi5418PJG-2FVcgrMcYustbKXDB-2Bx8doONBIe-2FsXLdK1SRmmPGSLTJ1vlZwm2FHtejSF4gKR3o3ZAmg7UWJy2XvXGmajFr5wrSy1YwPw0bvlbpqbHIbmGtHWz-2BWu44blFMLvkNBxYiv7hC216yfphXaMAd8PTV-2BQMUvu-2FyVg5wnFfDQ7J-2B6CStqptYFb6Wl1-2BZaq75xcHjVbHAmPjJnlMXaRyjaQQ5dToB4yOaJRIcYI-3D) .

APR CARMEL LISTING WINS HGTV'S ULTIMATE
HOUSE HUNT

HGTV recently completed its global competition with 48 companies and listings in 14 different countries, naming APR Agent Greg Albertson's $2.295 million listing in Carmel as the 'Living Large in a Small Spaces' winner. The home, listed at 2 SW 11th in Carmel, is a 1,566 custom cottage built in 2007.

Two APR listings in Carmel were finalists for the 'Living Large in Small Spaces' category of the competition. We congratulate both Melanie Rolfe Rosen and Greg Albertson for being nominated, and to Greg and his clients for winning in the Small Spaces category. For more information, read on (http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=9eRBURSqPvOmurN-2FVMHiAXtY6Uo-2Fn9DKlhaESpAFc6HT1N5MCPfYn-2FlvVHfSydrb1kzUU1efBx3AHdx5gZ5KzxMReBsNsZI8hgIQXytnjst52atBdIAQluoCpms-2FmnrrcKYiY1UIL-2FfBBGX1vdYX6w-3D-3D_aXojoE8p6FFhi0fBXE9V1LziNhIp9s9MNoZg3crHJiFgPyK4QH1EdLRK5b18SMnZswnAnCJyz1e3r81hqR1nGu-2BfzDh-2BTQvSpXaqbiEeXAGt1-2BrIxk8lYD-2B36172UlVEUUN4-2BDck3omKt1pwH8F82R0jQlcADri-2BUl1CLe1l9E1mcgBPxjERTXWJUkcuj9LKbFi5418PJG-2FVcgrMcYustcIZuWcxNcg0kogZnX1VdgiWpCtNPexS5GNTyMMgX4oVGlLTcQBGAl8OslQqVuV-2FxkT-2Foij0lHdJn8AwEYlMS2mVMYCm8Bp-2FGYnPVqSwQ-2BAG8jFSQv0IwVsYYL3GskGOTzChARKhVjPCaGTlpec5-2Fy-2FeNWlBj-2F6Y3aXCnrgQJrzp1BtqHK3fsqvmmlzporkK-2FeYYB3b8GWuhxtP-2BGvDPCcg-3D) .

 

 

PULSE OF THE REAL ESTATE MARKET: WHERE WE ARE AND WHAT COMES NEXT

By David Bellamy

Last February, I predicted an early start to a hot spring real estate market (http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=8HDb3jLESdlM3e-2B6yCRzZnSRho8kgSMCD77mJK6Xf-2BNhIv0bzhanFkXZmo9WAHEtO8ZldN79jTBP90zprAx1W-2BChHRRBIyryjOKnCyecZqHu5pOCjNYCdXK-2FimCDzaEa_aXojoE8p6FFhi0fBXE9V1LziNhIp9s9MNoZg3crHJiFgPyK4QH1EdLRK5b18SMnZswnAnCJyz1e3r81hqR1nGu-2BfzDh-2BTQvSpXaqbiEeXAGt1-2BrIxk8lYD-2B36172UlVEUUN4-2BDck3omKt1pwH8F82R0jQlcADri-2BUl1CLe1l9E1mcgBPxjERTXWJUkcuj9LKbFi5418PJG-2FVcgrMcYustUPIi7XDfNBp0OvFMX31pRnOXhJDB-2FhX5oXVye6Eo1OaYhOsR30-2FMqeCCzYrqqNGjkeX6178PE5RkJ1VtMCeE04sKp27bL6req5t1kaqLnBK2o1B5g0rqvFN3pzHUYKiL8FF-2FjS8Ht8Av2NFWHC28a31gmv7qASalS5nkJvIWmjnjO3bgqCxnaVBu-2BikYg5l5mBB52uRkDflSFtyIeDqKIk-3D) . By and large, that prediction was borne out with entry level housing remaining competitive while the luxury market followed its conservative, but expansive momentum into the summer.

At the close of the second quarter of 2017, those predicted trends remain mostly constant: rising home prices in San Francisco continue to push buyers eastward into Alameda County, where overall median home prices rose 9 percent over the same six-month period in 2016. There were few outliers in this trend. Median home prices for Q1 & Q2 of 2017, compared to that same period in 2016 rose:

Inventory continues to be the driving factor in both the decrease in number of units sold as well as generally rising home prices across the Bay Area and Northern California.

Due to the economic climate, the real estate market in our region continues to shift. The impact of limited inventory and changing tech, biotech, advanced manufacturing and other industries is evident. Median home prices are rising while the number of closed sales in terms of units across all of the 10 counties served by Alain Pinel Realtors have mainly declined. Again, this is due primarily to limited inventory. A few exceptions included Santa Clara and San Mateo counties, both with 1 percent increases in the number of closed sales year-to-date through June 30, 2017 compared to the same period in 2016. San Francisco and Napa counties experienced 2 percent increases in closed sales during the same period.

We can expect to see this pattern to continue through the balance of 2017, driven by an ongoing pattern of limited inventory, the expected and continued uptick in mortgage rates and any related shifts in key Northern California employment sectors. Given the shortage of opportunities for buyers through 2017 and the reluctance of potential sellers to dive into the market, buyers and sellers alike will need experienced agents to help them gauge the best opportunities in individual markets and show them how to plan accordingly.

The good news is many of those agents are at APR. We were once again ranked as the number one brokerage in 2017 in many of the most desirable Northern California markets. This is due in large part to our agents maintaining a deep network of potential sellers, having a keen understanding of the real estate landscape, offering outstanding customer service and being able to discern and advise clients on the difference between irrational exuberance in the market from otherwise solid buying and selling decisions.

tickets.description:
This is a follow-up to your previous request #39884 "cannot pull up a pdf in the..."

HI,

I’m trying to get the CMA system to work in SAVI and I’m not finding it overly thorough to where it is not pulling everything from the MLS.  For instance,

A property address located at 2298 Ocaso Camino, Fremont closed on 8/29/2017.  This is a highly relevant comp to a listing I’m trying to price on the same street however SAVi is not pulling it up in the CMA.  In addition, I was unable to obtain any “active” listings in my search criteria (went .75 mile radius around the property at 2111 ocaso camino).  The mls system provides me 3 active listings, SAVI shows nothing.

 

This seems to be a constant struggle with this system and its accuracy.  What can we do to fix the glitch?

 

Thank you,

Kelly King

 

 

 

“like me on facebook”  www.facebook.com/kellykingrealestate

From: MISSUPPORT
Sent: Wednesday, October 25, 2017 3:24 PM
To: All APR Company Offices <AllAPRCompanyOffices@apr.com>
Subject: zipForm Plus Broker Edition – important message about continuing your access to the APR Forms Library

 

Dear APR Agents,

 

We are happy to announce the launch of zipForm® Plus Broker Edition.  As many of you are aware, the APR Library of forms and advisories will soon be removed from the Membership Edition of zipForm Plus.  (The Membership Edition is the standard individual zipForm Plus account that all CAR members can access).  Broker Edition will ensure your continued access to all APR required forms and advisories.  APR has arranged for access to Broker Edition at no cost to you. 

 

For easier access, we have provided all agents with direct access to zipForm Plus Broker Edition via a new tile/icon on the front page of the SAVI Dashboard that looks like this: 

 

The first time you access zipForm Plus Broker Edition from SAVI, you will be asked to enter your NRDS ID # (Find your number at: Find Your NRDS ID # (https://reg.realtor.org/roreg.nsf/retrieveID?OpenForm) ) and last name.  After your initial registration, you simply click on the zipForm tile in SAVI to access your account without any additional log in required. 

If you have an existing APR zipForm Plus Broker Edition account, after entering your NRDS ID # and last name, click on “Yes, I have an existing account”.  This will prompt you to enter your Username and Password.

 

 

Please refer to the attached FAQ for further details on Broker Edition, obtaining your NRDS ID #, transferring active and past transactions and other helpful information.  If you have any questions about accessing Broker Edition, please contact Diana Costas at dcostas@apr.com.

 

Thank you,

The APR Marketing, Training, and Technology teams

Begin forwarded message: From: Kerry Sexton > Date: November 5, 2017 at 2:14:42 PM CST To: Dave Walsh > Subject: Fwd: How do I add my listings Hi Dave More info below. Kerry Kerry Sexton Alain Pinel Realtors 408-476-4844 Ksexton@apr.com Sent from my iPhone Begin forwarded message: From: Nextdoor Support > Date: November 5, 2017 at 12:13:10 PM PST To: ksexton@apr.com Subject: Re: How do I add my listings Reply-To: help@nextdoor.com __________________________________ ________________________________ Kerry Sexton Subject: How do I add my listings ________________________________ NOV 05, 2017 | 12:13PM PST Seth replied: Hi Kerry, Thanks for getting back to us. Please check with the person at your brokerage in charge of syndicating listings. Once they’ve made these changes to the information they submit for syndication, they should be reflected in our system within 48 – 72 hours. Let me know if you don’t see the changes in that timeframe. Best, Seth Nextdoor ​​ ________________________________ How did we do? Please rate your support experience. [Great] | [Good] | [Fair] | [Poor] | ________________________________ NOV 05, 2017 | 11:20AM PST Kerry replied: Hi Seth How can I get you the needle description? Kerry Kerry Sexton Alain Pinel Realtors 408-476-4844 Ksexton@apr.com ________________________________ NOV 05, 2017 | 10:53AM PST Seth replied: Hi Kerry, Thanks for following up. I see that this listing is missing a description on our end. Let me know if there’s anything else I can help you with. Best, Seth Nextdoor ​​ ________________________________ How did we do? Please rate your support experience. [Great] | [Good] | [Fair] | [Poor] | ________________________________ NOV 05, 2017 | 07:42PM PDT Kerry replied: Hi Seth, The properties are sent directly from the MLS and all of that information is on there. Can you please let me know what exactly you are missing from this transfer of the documentation so that I can talk with my tech group at APR and have them fix the items. Thanks so much, Kerry [cid:image001.png@01D355A5.0C858C80] From: Nextdoor Support > Reply-To: "help@nextdoor.com" > Date: Saturday, November 4, 2017 at 1:45 PM To: Kerry Sexton > Subject: Re: How do I add my listings ________________________________ NOV 04, 2017 | 01:44PM PDT Seth replied: Hi Kerry, Sorry for the trouble you’ve had adding your listing to Nextdoor. While we do have your listing in our system, we’re not currently displaying it in the Real Estate section because it’s missing some required data. To resolve this issue, please check with the person at your brokerage in charge of syndicating listings. Let them know that before a listing can be displayed on Nextdoor, the following data must be included: * Number of bedrooms * Number of bathrooms * Square Footage * MLS ID * Description * Photos * Price * Broker Name * Broker Contact Information If any of these required fields are missing from the dataset your brokerage syndicates with Nextdoor, your listing will not display until this information is updated and filled in correctly. Once you’ve made these changes to the information you submit for syndication, they should be reflected in our system within 48 – 72 hours. If you still do not see your listing displaying in the Real Estate section after this period, please let us know and we’ll look into this further. Let me know if you have any other questions. Best, Seth Nextdoor ​​ ________________________________ How did we do? Please rate your support experience. Q3 2017 Santa Clara County (http://o1.apr.com/wf/click?upn=IQ2QHnIBahxSr-2BljTHi-2Fdr-2F9XkMzhyLMQlyvPg1ebitEIrBFPy4BPqBJjIdEj8k3TECqdh5AmFKAa7tOPxOb5Eg5w7318D6K1Ki8fOC2Hdb0dBRBVCLVlaBxnSTO-2B3mB_FArvgExwu8EIdbyNPBlN1BcV8XnCUDeE-2BkHgkhUIirSms6h031fN-2FqwXXzZqI65AMcDSO6Iwsk7zeC0ykWfDnCLDSSgXuDIx2Mak2AVFlVj7-2FZpp2NzudWRN-2ByUjuKDxpPyvoHpAs7WTtu1btB8KdSSWXY6TS-2FKxGiclbJF3JAGcRGRzIYYZhXaNMwDDe-2F4-2FTJ9u9TcLVSFm6AVtqKgTH8MKUmfUt4gvEK1Xv9aSmwlrKOVR8IEiONZzyH7M8Av-2Fi0DLe7rrVNnuVtxsw5UfDQPheKSBS-2FjUPdVM4uywcKRZhnSjWHajEoHUumF8fYa3u2Fpy5WE0YlFmozPU3qgN7h7gnI6i7LQum62ZEqqBlenQqme02gJ60L5fw6sxhu3Dxz3UXpaVtF1uayCTaqP4dgflpk7IDEiC2c7oFg09mo-3D)

THIRD QUARTER MARKET REPORT   |   2016 VS. 2017

The Santa Clara County real estate market continues to surprise the industry. Multiple offers abound at all but the highest price points, with sellers receiving upwards of 104 percent of their asking price. Median sales price continues to climb and averages $1,180,000 for single-family homes and $720,000 for condos/townhomes. The available-to-purchase inventory level dropped 54 percent compared to last year’s numbers, leaving buyers scrambling for any available properties that are in their price range.

The planned unit development portion of inventory is also noticeably below last year’s available supply. This could be a result of extremely high buyer demand in all entry-level housing. As of this moment, almost 75 percent of the available supply of these units are already under contract.

Even with the scarcity of available supply, total closed sales for the year are up 3 percent year-over-year. All of this translates into a red-hot seller’s market that continues to pose a challenge for buyers.

tickets.subject: New Website Feedback
tickets.description:
Good afternoon, 
I just wanted to leave some feedback for some bugs regarding the CRM campaigns. 

1. It would be very beneficial and professional if the email campaigns automatically included a salutation specific to each contact we are sending it to. I know other CRMs (and I think even Outlook) do this, and I hope that we can too. 

2. Within the body of the campaign I am sending out, I can insert a hyperlink, but I can't edit the hyperlink. For example, in Outlook I can edit a long ugly hyperlink to just say "More Info", so it's more clean and professional, but I can seem to figure out if we can do it within the CRM campaign. If we can't, I think that is another necessary feature to offer. 

Thank you in advance! 
Amanda

tickets.subject: Chat with Gail Morris
tickets.description:
Chat started on 2017-11-11 10:21 PM UTC

(10:21:45 PM) *** Gail Morris joined the chat ***
(10:21:45 PM) Gail Morris: Hi
TV in Mill Valley front office of Alain Pinel, CMV21KV9 says "no signal".  Have tried everything I can think of and nothing working.
(10:22:09 PM) *** Chelsea Wester joined the chat ***
(10:22:51 PM) Chelsea Wester: Hi Gail
(10:23:10 PM) Chelsea Wester: It sounds like the display is either asleep or the channel isn't on the right source.
(10:25:35 PM) Chelsea Wester: You can use the remote and press 'input' or 'source' and make sure the input source is either HDMI 1 (usually)
(10:26:32 PM) Gail Morris: Tried that and is on HDMI1
(10:27:43 PM) Chelsea Wester: Try moving the mouse or pressing the space bar on the keyboard
(10:28:42 PM) Chelsea Wester: The input source might need to be on HDMI 2
(10:29:45 PM) Gail Morris: Ok....moved mouse and pressed space bar and nothing happened.  Did try HDMI2 before but will try again
(10:31:17 PM) Gail Morris: Still nothing
(10:31:52 PM) Chelsea Wester: I just restarted the computer.
(10:32:04 PM) Chelsea Wester: Do you know if there is a display switch plugged in?
(10:32:22 PM) Chelsea Wester: Do you know what input source the TV is usually on for the computer? HDMI 1?
(10:32:53 PM) Gail Morris: I think it is HDMI1...Switch is on...
(10:33:59 PM) Chelsea Wester: The display switch is on 1 or 2?
(10:34:51 PM) Gail Morris: is on 1
(10:37:02 PM) Chelsea Wester: Please make sure all HDMI cables are plugged in correctly.
(10:37:41 PM) Chelsea Wester: The computer is on and functioning properly.  If the TV is normally on input source HDMI 1, there might be a cable that is un-plugged.
(10:39:20 PM) Gail Morris: I looked around and don't see anything but will try again.  Will get back to you if doesn't work.  Thank you.
(10:46:37 PM) Gail Morris: Discounted everything...put all back and still nothing
(10:48:20 PM) Chelsea Wester: Make sure the input source is on HDMI 1
(10:48:27 PM) Chelsea Wester: Change the display switch to '2'
(10:50:06 PM) Gail Morris: where is the display switch?
(10:50:59 PM) Chelsea Wester: If there is a display switch, it might be tucked in the cabinet with the computer.
(10:51:09 PM) Chelsea Wester: You said the display switch was on '1'?
(10:51:27 PM) Gail Morris: its on HDMI1
(10:51:55 PM) *** Gail Morris left the chat ***

THIRD QUARTER MARKET REPORT   |   2016 VS. 2017

The Peninsula market remains constrained with very low inventory. The number of properties for sale is down from the already low inventory during the same quarter last year. Days on market for listings remains low as well, with most cities averaging fewer than 30 days. Number of units sold has remained fairly level compared to a year ago, however, and median prices are up 9 percent county-wide.

THE COST OF HOMEOWNERSHIP



Today’s homebuyers are finding the cost of homeownership in Northern California goes beyond financial concerns. Rising home prices and extended commuting contribute to the worries of buyers and sellers alike, as does a historic shortage of available housing inventory. The combination, in effect, adds pressure to an already stressful process.

There is no shortage of news coverage and market reports pointing to rising prices, bidding wars, and waiting lists of eager home buyers – all of which is driven in large part by the dramatic dearth of available inventory.

In the third quarter of 2017, across all of counties where Alain Pinel Realtors® operates, there were significant decreases in available housing inventory compared to the same period in 2016:


[https://s3-us-west-1.amazonaws.com/booj-newsletters/article-images/44/44/2017_november_article_image.jpg]


Only Napa and Sonoma counties showed increases in housing inventory at the end of September 2017 compared to the same period last year. However, given the horrific fires that have ravaged the region, we can expect to see those inventory numbers drastically revised.

Given this shortage of opportunity and the reluctance of potential sellers to dive into the market, buyers and sellers alike will need experienced agents to help them navigate all of the costs of buying or selling a home in this climate.

The good news is many of those agents are at APR. Largely because our agents maintain a deep network of potential sellers and a keen understanding of the real estate landscape, APR was once again ranked the number one brokerage in 2017 in many of the most desirable Northern California markets. Despite low inventory, our team continues to list and transact a significant share of the available residential real estate in our markets, putting our buyers and sellers in the strongest positions possible.

tickets.subject: 5131 Fairfax Listing APR851933
tickets.description:
Hello,

  I am trying to fix my agent’s APR Exclusive for an e-flyer she wants to go out today.

5131 Fairfax- I accidently originally put it in as 5131 Fairfield and that shows up under Featured Listings still that way- can we correct? Also, in her APR Exclusive- it does show correct

 

Listing# APR851933

 

But when you click on Map & Community- it says Community information for the property cannot be found. Doesn’t this autopopulate and how can we get this corrected for the e-flyer to go out today? Let me know thank you!

 

 

LISA DUNCAN

FRONT DESK CONCIERGE/MARKETING COORDINATOR

Alain Pinel Realtors® Montclair | Alameda 

O 510.339.8900 | E Recpt1mc@apr.com

apr.com

tickets.subject: Feedback Ad Tool Suggestion
tickets.description:
Hi,

tickets.subject: RE: Training Tip of the Week: Best way to search for APR Exclusive Listings
tickets.raw_subject: RE: Training Tip of the Week: Best way to search for APR Exclusive Listings
tickets.description:
Thank you for the tips. However, there is a serious problem with the APR exclusives. There are houses in there that show as “active” when, in fact, they were sold (on or off MLS) many month ago. Is there any way to link the APR exclusives to our own Skyslope, so that when a sale is entered into Skyslope as pending or whatever, the status on APR exclusives will also get updated?  This has been an ongoing problem and it is very time consuming and frustrating to try to contact all of the listing agent only to find out the homes are no longer available.

 

If it can’t be programmed to update automatically, can we ask the office administrator who handles Skyslope to make this change every time a sale is reported?

 

That would be very helpful. It still leaves the issue of the property just not selling and it is now expired... However, that is not so common.

 

Can you also sent this to APR support.... I can’t find an email for APR support.

Thanks very much.

Lynne

 

Lynne Mercer

DRE#00796211

650-906-0162

Lmercer@apr.com

 

From: Training Center APR
Sent: Tuesday, November 21, 2017 12:21 PM
To: All Of The APR Offices
Subject: Training Tip of the Week: Best way to search for APR Exclusive Listings

 

BEST WAY TO SEARCH FOR APR EXCLUSIVE LISTINGS

 

1. In SAVI, click the MLS Listing Search tile on the main dashboard > select APR Exclusives in the search criteria section.

2. Choose a County and city or area from the dropdown or enter a zip code.

3. Click VIEW PROPERTIES button under the Active/Pending properties.

4. Scroll down to view a list of APR Exclusive properties.

More tips:

Enter Exclusive Listings for Coming Soon properties or to generate an APR EXCLUSIVE number for use in obtaining marketing materials (Xpressdocs) by visiting SAVI > LIST & SELL > EXCLUSIVE LISTINGS.

 

Exclusive Listings are HIDDEN by default – that means they will not be visible on your agent website, or in Luxury Portfolio, unless you UNHIDE them on the EXCLUSIVE LISTINGS tool.

 

 ……………………………………………

 

DO YOU KNOW HOW TO STORE DOCUMENTS IN THE CLOUD?

 

Sign up for the new training “Storing Documents in the Cloud” classroom training next week. Visit savi.apr.com, click the Training tile, select The Academy. Click the Calendar tab to register!

 

APR TRAINING

training@apr.com

tickets.subject: Newsletter problem
tickets.description:
I had hoped to set up a newsletter auto email campaign over this Thanksgiving break. However, I simply cannot get it to work.

 

Some time ago I set myself up to receive the newsletters as a test program, and it says the emails were sent but I have never received anything. I have checked clutter, junk email, mimecast etc.

 

Now I thought I would try again but there isn’t even a newsletter to look at. I understand they are sent automatically, but why don’t you leave them available for people who may want to work on a different schedule, or who may want to review what has already gone out? How can I even see what they are supposed to look like?

 

This is very frustrating. Should I call tech support or should I call Training?  I don’t want to wait until December... too busy!!

 

Thanks very much

Lynne

 

Lynne Mercer

DRE#00796211

650-906-0162

Lmercer@apr.com

satisfaction_rating.comment: Excellent. i reallt appreciate the reminder about the newsletter. I would have forgotten for sure!!  Lynne
